Comments_List: The past tense in Hebrew and a large amount of other vocabulary and grammar.
I continued to learn a lot this semester about both the Hebrew language and Israeli culture. I also gained a new confidence with speaking Hebrew.
I learned about the Hebrew language, and Jeewish and Israeli culture, this semester, we spent a lot of time studying past tense verbs

Small homework assignments every night to practice what was learned in class were helpful, as were small group discussion activities in class. There wasn't a strong focus on strict translation, but rather a focus on original production in the target language. The grading is a little easy, so it's hard to get clear feedback sometimes.
I enjoy the small class size and the way we review materials consistently while also learning new things.

Yes! The Hebrew department is so much fun at Yale. All the professors are lovely and take such good care of their students. It's like a little family. If you have any interest in Hebrew you should join the department.
Yes, taking Hebrew has been one of the best academic decisions I have made so far at Yale.
